title.narrative: STITCH-Myanmar

description.narrative: As the Sustainable Textile Initiative: Together for Change (STITCH) consortium, we envision a global garment industry that contributes to an equal and just society by respecting human rights in the world of work. The global garment industry is fragmented and complex, involving many actors across the globe, with varying levels of power and influence. This activity relates to Fair Wear's work contributing to Myanmar under STITCH.

title.narrative: Increased collaboration
Number of influencing activities held with policymakers, companies, influential decision-makers on key STITCH Lobby and Advocacy goals/strategies

description.narrative: Influencing activities include dialogues, meetings, consultations, briefings, seminars, workshops, conferences, summits, etc. held with policymakers, companies, influential decision-makers on main STITCH issues, claims and policy goals

comment.narrative: According to ITUC’s Global Rights Index (ITUC, 2021), the situation for trade unions and freedom of association in Myanmar has highly worsened from 2020 to 2021, being classified as a country with No guarantee of rights due to breakdown of the rule of law.

FW aims to conduct 25 L&A activities with different actors such as government officials, political leaders, media personnel, directly engaged brands (member brands of ETI or FW), indirectly engaged brands (not member brands of ETI or FW), TUs/ LRO and other actors towards improvement of labor rights.

title.narrative: Factories and business associations are capacitated for social dialogue and sourcing dialogue
Number of stories of change on social dialogue

description.narrative: Case examples where programs efforts to improve social dialogue have led to learning opportunities

title.narrative: Innovative and improved approaches to remedy are implemented for garment workers
Number of stories on change on remediation and redressals

description.narrative: Case examples where programs remediation and redressal efforts have led to learning opportunities

title.narrative: Research has led to the creation of evidence on labour conditions in support of lobby and advocacy
Number of success stories where use of STITCH research has contributed towards achievement of lobby and advocacy goals

description.narrative: Case examples where programs research has contributed towards achievement of lobby and advocacy goals

title.narrative: Conduct research to create evidence on labour conditions
Number of reports focused on labor conditions (e.g. studies, publication, position papers) conducted

description.narrative: Number of reports (e.g. studies, publication, position papers) focused on labour conditions conducted and published by the program

title.narrative: Reach
Number of Registered and non-registered sectoral level TUs supported through capacity strengthening by STITCH

description.narrative: Capacity strengthening support includes: Over the course of the program, STITCH aims to share tools/methodologies/ research and provide training/ webinars/ learning sessions to partners on different topics such as Policy Influencing Lobby and Advocacy, leadership skills, purchasing practices, social dialogue, gender guidance etc.

title.narrative: Number of Registered and non-registered Sectoral level Trade Unions supported by STITCH

description.narrative: Trade Unions can be supported through capacity support and/or financial support by the program

title.narrative: Capacity Strengthening
Number of unique learning events by the program

description.narrative: Learning event are events where the aim is to share experiences with intention of collectively learning from them.

title.narrative: Number of men participants of learning events
Number of men participants of training
Number of new or improved guiding tools / systems / methodologies produced by STITCH and shared with stakeholders

description.narrative: Number of new or improved guiding tools / systems / methodologies produced by STITCH and shared with stakeholders

title.narrative: Number of unique training delivered by the program

description.narrative: Training topics: leadership skills, purchasing practices, social dialogue, sourcing dialogue, gender awareness, policy influencing lobby and advocacy, monitoring and evaluation or other topics
